description.narrative: - Role of the counterpart in the project In the Commune of Tillabery, (local level) Oxfam, through the Project ##Civic education and capacity building for more tax justice in Tillabery## will be working with SOS Civisme; CSOs, women and youth, local leaders will be the main stakeholders with whom influencing actions will be undertaken toward the Commune. - Long term outcomes that the counterpart will contribute to These outcomes will link to the outcomes in the project proposal as well as outcomes mentioned in the CO project description More public resources are available for sustainable development and fight against poverty of more vulnerable groups, particularly women and youth at the local level - Geographical location of interventions of counterpart The NGO SOS Civisme has a national scope in that it is present in the 8 regions of Niger. But as part of the Civic Education and Capacity Building projectfor more tax justice in Tillabéry '' she plans to intervene, in partnership with Oxfam COin the Urban Commune of Tillabéry. It intends to reach actors at the local level, such as: civil society organizations, communal councilors, traders, women and young people, private citizens, etc. - General terms the intervention strategies that will beapplied Therefore, we want to work particularly in favour of more vulnerable groups (women and youth). The global strategy consist to reinforce local CSOs through capacity building and training in relevant thematics , then CSOs will reinvest in local actors like W<(>&<)>Y, traders, privates, in order to influence the Commune

participating-org.narrative: Savoir Oser Solidariser pour le Civisme au Niger

The NGO Savoir, Oser, Solidariser pour le Civisme au Niger (SOS-Civisme) Niger is a non-governmental organization (NGO) of Nigerianlaw created in 1999 by Nigerian volunteers. It was recognized by the Government of Niger by Order No. 109 / MI / AT /DAPJ / SA of October 26, 2000. SOS Civisme Niger is the Nigerian branch of a West African Network (Countries: Benin, Burkina Faso, Côte d'Ivoire, Mali, Togo and Niger) civil society organizations committed to promoting civic responsibility, good governance , Democracy and peaceat the national and local levels. In each country, the section is called "SOS-Civisme", accompanied by the name of the country of implantation. SOS Civisme, is administered by a General Council of three (3) members, A National Coordination composed of five (5) members. The Vision of SOS Citizenship consists of "Solidarity for an emerging Niger, built on the values of good governance, democracy, civic culture, equity and dialogue in favor of peace and sustainable development" . Its mission is to contribute to the building of responsible citizenship at the national and local levels through: (i) strengthening the sense of public service and public interest, (iii) strengthening accountability (iiii) strengthening the civic spirit of citizens and citizen control of public action, (iv) promoting good democratic governance, (v) The consolidation of peace and stability.
